Statistical Databank - National Bureau of Statistics of Moldova
column8: Data of sown area in farms and agricultural enterprises was summed in the dataset. Stîngă Nistrului corresponds to Dubăsari including the Transnistria part. Other administrative units from Transnistria were not included in the source data. Rezina refers to the Moldova's raion MDA-1644, not MDA-1645 which is controlled by Transnistria; here adm1_code is used instead of iso_1366_2. T.A.U. Gagauzia was input as Comrat

column8: Data partitioned in multiple pdfs. Some have been translated from arab to french or English. Temporal replacement  is ignored (e.g., arriere saison and primeurs are counted as independent crops summing the sown hectares although they may be sown in the same area in different seasons). Data on Basbas (بسباس) might be mistranslated and has been identified as chili pepper (standardized as pepper). Data from reference #142 are only retained for governorates that had not any data on "cultures mâraicheres d'été ou d'hiver", and ignored for those that already had this kind of data. Data on fenouille (بسباس) has been included within "onion" std. crop. Arboriculture data from ref #143 is introduced only for those fruits that had not any specific filière. When arboriculture data was available from governorate data sets, they were replaced by data of this reference

column7: Central Dissemination Data - Turkish Statistical Institute
column8: 01.13.39.00.07. (Pepino) has been translated to "courgette" (since "cucumber" was already clearly translated from other cells).

Data was not consistently separated into any administrative unit type. We used Health Boards with minor corrections, namely (1) Joining Greater Glasgow and Clyde with Lanarkshire spatial units to our dataset's Clyde Valley, (2) Adding together our dataset's rows for Highlands and Argyl & Butte for equivalency with current Highland polygon;  and asumming Forth Valley as equivalent to Central
